privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This privacy policy explains how the Semester Grade Calculator collects, uses, and protects user data.
privacy.section1Content: We do not collect any personal information. The calculation process happens entirely locally in your browser, and no data is sent to our servers.
privacy.section2Content: Our site may use technical cookies for basic functionality. These do not collect any personal information.
privacy.section3Content: We may use Vercel Analytics on our site, which collects anonymous usage statistics.
privacy.section4Content: Since we don't collect any personal information, there is no risk of data breaches.
privacy.section5Content: We may make changes to this policy. Updates will be posted on this page.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.a1: Enter your seminar and colloquium grades. The calculator automatically calculates the average (Seminar × 0.4 + Colloquium × 0.6), multiplies it by 3, and adds attendance and independent work points.
faq.a2: Attendance score: 10 - (10 × absent hours / total hours). For example, if you miss 6 out of 60 hours: 10 - (10 × 6/60) = 9 points.
faq.a3: The maximum score is 50: Base score (30) + Attendance (10) + Independent work (10).
faq.q4: What is the minimum passing grade?
faq.a4: Typically the minimum passing grade in universities is 26, but this may vary depending on university and department requirements.
faq.a5: No, all calculations are performed locally in your browser. No data is sent to the server.
faq.q6: Can I use it on mobile?
faq.a6: Yes, the site is fully responsive and works on all devices (phone, tablet, computer).
faq.q7: How can I save the result?
faq.a7: After the result appears, you can take a screenshot or note down the information.
faq.q8: What should I do if the calculator gives wrong results?
faq.a8: First check the information you entered. If the problem persists, contact us through the Contact page.
